availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Patrick Upshire Major (Frankfort, Kentucky, attorney and commonwealth's attorney)

body.p: Frankfort, Kentucky, attorney and commonwealth's attorney. Frankfort native. Son of Samuel I. M. Major and Martha H. Bohannan Major. Member of the Episcopal Church in Frankfort. Educated in Frankfort in the private academy of Burwell B. Sayre. Graduated from Union College in Schenectady, New York, in 1842. Founding member of Chi Psi fraternity. Studied law with Thomas B. Monroe, Sr., and Charles S. Morehead. Admitted to the bar in 1844. Member of the Democratic Party. Attorney in St. Louis, Missouri, in 1850. County attorney for Franklin County from 1852 to 1856. Commonwealth's attorney for the Eighth Judicial District of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from 1856 to 1862. Member of the Masonic Order in Kentucky and International Order of Oddfellows.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Missouri, County, St. Louis Ward 3, p. 381B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort, p. 241.
Find A Grave, "Judge Patrick Upshire Major (1822-1903)," Memorial #69442556, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/69442556 (accessed March 3, 2017).
H. Levin, The Lawyers and Lawmakers of Kentucky (Chicago: The Lewis Publishing Company, 1897), 122-24.
"Kentucky Election," The Louisville Daily Courier (Louisville, Ky.), August 20, 1856, p. 3.
"Grand Barbecue at Palsgrove Landing," The Louisville Daily Courier (Louisville, Ky.), September 8, 1860, p. 1.
